modules.description: This module generates JSON responses for authentication events using values from a provided `Variables` module. It handles three specific cases: successful login, login error, and logout, each returning a corresponding Dream response promise. It is used to send standardized JSON-formatted HTTP responses for authentication flows in a Dream-based web application.

This module generates HTML responses for authentication events like successful login, login errors, and logout. It works with Dream requests and responses, producing promise-based outputs tailored to user authentication flows. Concrete use cases include rendering confirmation pages after a user logs in, displaying error messages on failed attempts, and generating redirects or messages after logout.

This module generates HTML responses for authentication events using customizable templates and variables. It works with strings, HTML elements, and authentication data structures like user identifiers and tokens. Concrete use cases include rendering login forms, error messages, and success pages directly from authentication workflows.

This module generates JSON responses for authentication events using values from a provided `Variables` module. It handles three specific cases: successful login, login error, and logout, each returning a corresponding Dream response promise. It is used to send standardized JSON-formatted HTTP responses for authentication flows in a Dream-based web application.

This module provides functions to generate standardized JSON and HTML responses for authentication workflows. It handles specific cases like login success/error and logout, producing appropriate HTTP responses with structured data. The JSON submodule works with authentication variables to create machine-readable responses, while the HTML submodule renders user-facing pages using templates and authentication data.
